column5: how big a knife do they allow into canada?......i have a buck folding knife and a pocket knife....are those legal?....thanks steve
Those should be fine. No switchblades or butterfly type knives are allowed. Of course you can't take them on a plane with you.Jerry

I know one time going across at I Falls they were a little testy about the driver having a knife within reaching distance,..I can't remember how big the knife was,...But the look on the border gaurd face was priceless when our driver tossed the knife from the drivers window into the box of the truck without looking and said "I can't reach it know",....More than one occasion I wondered how we didn't get locked up,.......
When the ask the question about any weapons in the vehicle, we always tell them about our fillet knives and the let us go without any other questions (at least about weapons)

Ditto. I usually preface it with, " No disrespect, ma'am (sir), but I have ...." I usually get a smile and a wink and told that "It'll be fine". No disrespect, but I've seen some of the female officers from whom I'd rather NOT have the wink....
Steve,l as long as it's not an switch blade or butterfly knife your fine. We do not have a restriction on blade length.
